text: [Music]
I'm Sara Nam I'm the CEO at lever and
lever is a software company based in San
Francisco and we're building modern
talent software's that companies can
power their next generation recruiting
first thing I do when I roll into the
office is instantly go head to the
Commons get myself a cup of coffee and
it's also a great opportunity to really
connect with all the different people
that work here I think a lot about what
CEOs have to do is actually paint a
picture of where we need to be and
actually trust the rest of the team to
step into that and make that a reality I
today really think of myself as a
designer CEO and in that sense I am
trying to help create you know a
seamless user experience for every
employee at lever to have the biggest
impact that they can you know I didn't
expect to work in technology I actually
grew up in Birmingham Alabama and in
Alabama not that many people work in
startups not that many people work in
technology and you know I think the one
thing that I would say growing up in
Alabama really created for me was a
sense that diversity inclusion would be
really important and how we formed our
culture and scaled our team so something
that lever does every month when we
onboard a new class of hires we actually
have a program that we call ramp camp
I get this chance to actually meet and
connect with folks and here kind of why
they made their decision to come to
lever and for a CEO that kind of
information is both invaluable
it helps me really understand you know
what it is that people are bringing into
the company but it's also so amazing to
hear all the different ambitions and
motivations and the sense of purpose
that people are bringing into the
company we believe in celebrating our
employees we create an actual animated
gif for every new hire that starts so we
actually plan some sort of you know a
choreography or like dance or sometimes
even like a joke and we bring it to life
and act out this gif and it's informal
me as a CEO I do spend a lot of time in
meetings big and small today I actually
have a meeting where I'm working with
our design team on naming a feature and
then a lot of them are one-on-ones you
can really mix it up by taking a walking
101 and getting a little sunshine and
maybe some coffee
maybe get a different perspective just
by shifting literally where you where
you're at
towards the end of the day I do have a
ritual you know around five o'clock I'll
go and do what you know people call the
wander I just kind of walk around the
office and you know it's really easy to
just spark up conversations with
whoever's kind of at their desk usually
people are winding down and so there's
an opportunity just here you know what's
going on what's happening at the end of
the day I am connecting all the human
potential here at lever to the most
meaningful work that we can be doing and
I take that really seriously and it's
what gets me up in the morning it's what
gets me really excited every day
[Music]
[Applause]
